themes: dominance of single organizations in funding
lack of equitable access for individual artists
competition between organizations and individual artists
exclusion based on years of experience
lack of transparency or clarity in application instructions
key_phrases: One cultural art organization should not be allowed to gobble up multiple grants
to the detriment of other cultural arts organizations
ALL AUSTIN ARTISTS should have access to funding
OG artists that put time in the trenches with little compensation
mid-career artists trying to sustain their practice
The number of years an artist has dedicated to their practice should not eliminate them from funding
they should not be forced to compete with cultural arts organizations for funding
barriers_identified: dominance of single organizations receiving multiple grants
lack of access for artists who did not receive specific application instructions
competition between individual artists and organizations for the same funding
exclusion of artists based on years of experience
solutions_proposed: Prevent one organization from receiving multiple project grants
Ensure all Austin artists have access to funding regardless of career stage or years of experience
Do not force individual artists to compete with organizations for funding
